articles.title: About me
articles.contents:
Jason E. Jannot
          
          
          
          
          
          About
          CV
          Pubs
          Projects
          Credits
          
          
          
          ☰
          
          
      
        
          
            
              
            
              About me
            
            
              
                
            
          
        
        
        
          
            I’m a Supervisory Research Fish Biologist and data
            scientist () at the Alaska
            Fisheries Science Center (AFSC) in the Fishery
            Monitoring and Analysis Division (FMA).
            
            Current Role
            I manage the AFSC FMA Analytical Services Program, a team
            of fishery data analysts. I am accountable for managing the
            processes and people responsible for processing, modeling,
            analysis, and reporting of fishery data, mainly data
            collected at-sea by fisheries
            observers and electronic
            monitoring systems.
            The FMA Analytical Services team seeks to develop
            insights from large fishery data sets which help guide
            strategic opportunities for fishery managers. I work closely
            with leaders, scientists and managers at the ASFC, NOAA
            Alaska Regional Office, North Pacific Fisheries
            Managment Council, and other agencies to support and
            implement high-quality, data-driven natural resource
            management decisions. The FMA Analytical Services team
            ensures data accuracy and consistent reporting by leveraging
            modern processes for automating data quality control and
            reproducible research. They use advanced data modeling,
            predictive modeling and analytical techniques to interpret
            key findings from fishery data which support fishery
            management outcomes.
            
            
            Research
            Since 2010, the focus of my research has been on marine
            species interactions with commercial fishing vessels,
            a.k.a., bycatch.
            Prior to 2010, my research focused on ecological
            processes in freshwater ecosystems and life history
            plasticity in freshwater organisms.
            
            
            Personal Interests
            In my spare time, I am also an avid cyclist and banjo
            player.
            Random Fact About Me: I spent a whole summer living in Beanpod
            Cabin (built ca. 1929).
            
          
        
      
    

    
      
        
          
            
              
            
              About me
            
            
              
                
                                  
              
            
            
              I’m a Supervisory Research Fish Biologist and data

              Current Role

              team of fishery data analysts. I am accountable for
              managing the processes and people responsible for
              processing, modeling, analysis, and reporting of fishery
              data, mainly data collected at-sea by fisheries
              observers and electronic
              monitoring systems.
              The FMA Analytical Services team seeks to develop
              insights from large fishery data sets which help guide
              strategic opportunities for fishery managers. I work
              closely with leaders, scientists and managers at the ASFC,
              NOAA
              Alaska Regional Office, North Pacific Fisheries
              Managment Council, and other agencies to support and
              implement high-quality, data-driven natural resource
              management decisions. The FMA Analytical Services team
              ensures data accuracy and consistent reporting by
              leveraging modern processes for automating data quality
              control and reproducible research. They use advanced data
              modeling, predictive modeling and analytical techniques to
              interpret key findings from fishery data which support
              fishery management outcomes.
              
              
              Research
              Since 2010, the focus of my research has been on marine
              species interactions with commercial fishing vessels,
              a.k.a., bycatch.
              Prior to 2010, my research focused on ecological
              processes in freshwater ecosystems and life history
              plasticity in freshwater organisms.
              
              
              Personal Interests
              In my spare time, I am also an avid cyclist and banjo
              player.
              Random Fact About Me: I spent a whole summer living in
              Beanpod
              Cabin (built ca. 1929).

articles.title: Credits
articles.contents:
Jason E. Jannot
          
          
          
          
          
          About
          CV
          Pubs
          Projects
          Credits
          
          
          
          ☰
          
          
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Credits
            
            
              
                
            
          
        
        
        
          
            
            The main inspiration for this website comes from John Paul Helveston. Not
            only did John’s site come in very handy as a reasonable
            template for this site; John also provides some really nifty
             functions
            that weave together R, CSS, and HTML, useful
            tips on how to use them and is generous enough to share
            them under CC BY-SA 4.0.
            Other major sources of inspiration for my site include
            the websites of: - Eric J.
            Ward - Emily
            Markowitz - The
            Distillery  Other sources of information and
            inspiration surrounding the use of
            , Rmarkdown and
            , include: - Julia S. Lowndes
            - Eli E.
            Holmes
            And, I would be remiss not to mention the
            distill package for R:
            Dervieux C, Allaire J, Iannone R, Presmanes Hill A, Xie Y
            (2022). distill: ‘R Markdown’ Format for Scientific and
            Technical Writing. R package version 1.5,
            https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=distill
          
        
      
    

    
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Credits
            
            
              
                
                                  
              
            
            
              
              The main inspiration for this website comes from John Paul Helveston.
              Not only did John’s site come in very handy as a
              reasonable template for this site; John also provides some
              really nifty
               functions
              that weave together R, CSS, and HTML, useful
              tips on how to use them and is generous enough to
              share them under CC BY-SA 4.0.
              Other major sources of inspiration for my site include
              the websites of: - Eric J.
              Ward - Emily
              Markowitz - The
              Distillery  Other sources of information and
              inspiration surrounding the use of
              , Rmarkdown and
              , include: - Julia S.
              Lowndes
              - Eli E.
              Holmes
              And, I would be remiss not to mention the
              distill package for R:
              Dervieux C, Allaire J, Iannone R, Presmanes Hill A, Xie
              Y (2022). distill: ‘R Markdown’ Format for Scientific
              and Technical Writing. R package version 1.5,
              https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=distill

articles.title: Projects
articles.contents:
Jason E. Jannot
          
          
          
          
          
          About
          CV
          Pubs
          Projects
          Credits
          
          
          
          ☰
          
          
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Projects
            
            
              
                
                    
                      
                        
                      
                    
                  
                                  
            
          
        
        
        
          
            
            Software
            
            bycatch
            R package This is a repository for applications of
            Bayesian bycatch models, using Stan for estimation. These
            models fit Bayesian GLMs (with or without time varying
            parameters, and with or without covariates) to estimate
            fleet-level bycatch rates. The primary applications of these
            models are protected species bycatch (e.g., ESA listed
            birds, marine mammals, sea turtles) in the groundfish
            fisheries off the west coast of the USA. Data compilation
            and analysis is done at the Northwest Fisheries Science
            Center (NWFSC) in Seattle. This is part of the NOAA
            Fisheries Integrated Toolbox.
            
            Fisheries Management
            
            2020-2022 - I served on NOAA’s National Bycatch
            Reduction Engineering Program.
            2018-2022 - I served on a number of seabird advisory
            and management bodies including: NOAA’s National Seabird
            Program Strategic Implementation Team, USFWS Short-tailed
            Albatross Recovery Team, Agreement on the Conservation of
            Albatross and Petrels, and the North Pacific Albatross Work
            Group.
            2013-2022 - I was the lead scientist, in
            collaboration with the NOAA West Coast Regional Office, on
            the Pacific Fishery Management Council’s Groundfish
            Endangered Species Workgroup from 2013-2022. During this
            time I led the reporting of fisheries bycatch of 5 species
            listed on the U.S. Endangered Species Act that interact with
            fisheries off the U.S. West Coast: humpback whales,
            leatherback sea turtles, short-tailed albatross, green
            sturgeon, and eulachon smelt.
            2011-2022 - I was the lead scientist reporting on the
            annual Pacific halibut (Hippoglossus stenolepis)
            bycatch in fisheries off the U.S. West Coast.
            
        
      
    

    
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Projects
            
            
              
                
                                    
                    
                      
                    
                  
                                  
              
            
            
              
              Software
              
              bycatch
              R package This is a repository for applications of
              Bayesian bycatch models, using Stan for estimation. These
              models fit Bayesian GLMs (with or without time varying
              parameters, and with or without covariates) to estimate
              fleet-level bycatch rates. The primary applications of
              these models are protected species bycatch (e.g., ESA

              groundfish fisheries off the west coast of the USA. Data
              compilation and analysis is done at the Northwest
              Fisheries Science Center (NWFSC) in Seattle. This is part
              of the NOAA
              Fisheries Integrated Toolbox.
              
              Fisheries Management
              
              2020-2022 - I served on NOAA’s National Bycatch
              Reduction Engineering Program.
              2018-2022 - I served on a number of seabird
              advisory and management bodies including: NOAA’s National
              Seabird Program Strategic Implementation Team, USFWS
              Short-tailed Albatross Recovery Team, Agreement on the
              Conservation of Albatross and Petrels, and the North
              Pacific Albatross Work Group.
              2013-2022 - I was the lead scientist, in
              collaboration with the NOAA West Coast Regional Office, on
              the Pacific Fishery Management Council’s Groundfish
              Endangered Species Workgroup from 2013-2022. During
              this time I led the reporting of fisheries bycatch of 5
              species listed on the U.S. Endangered Species Act that
              interact with fisheries off the U.S. West Coast: humpback
              whales, leatherback sea turtles, short-tailed albatross,
              green sturgeon, and eulachon smelt.
              2011-2022 - I was the lead scientist reporting on
              the annual Pacific halibut (Hippoglossus
              stenolepis) bycatch in fisheries off the U.S. West
              Coast.
